Accountant/Payroll -- Business Operations Analyst - job post High Tech High 20 reviews San Diego, CA $61,396 - $70,521 a year -  Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $61,396 - $70,521 a year Job Type Contract Business Operations Analyst Start Date: March 1st Developed by a coalition of San Diego civic leaders and educators, High Tech High opened in September 2000 as a small public charter school with plans to serve approximately 450 students. HTH has evolved into an integrated network of sixteen charter schools serving approximately 6,350 students in grades K-12 across four campuses. Located in San Diego County, California, High Tech High (HTH) is guided by four connected design principles—equity, personalization, authentic work, and collaborative design—that set aspirational goals and create a foundation for understanding our approach. If you are motivated by these principles, we encourage you to join our team! HTH seeks a Business Operations Analyst to provide critical accounting and payroll support. JOB SUMMARY The position requires general knowledge of common general accounting and payroll practices. Work consists of both routine and non-routine accounting and payroll work performed using general procedures and processes. Duties include: Maintains complete accounting, payroll, and benefits records for special accounts. Perform daily payroll, payroll-related, and accounting operations (processing timesheets and invoices). Manage workflow to ensure all payroll and related payable transactions are processed accurately and timely. Review, analyze and maintain statistical and financial records. Assist with filing retirement contribution reporting and reconciliation. Prepare journal entries to input into the accounting system. Assist with month-end, quarter-end, and year-end close processes and completion of close checklists. Assist with the development of accounting and payroll procedures to create efficiency for the organization. . Ensure compliance with applicable California Department of Education and fund accounting requirements. Other projects as assigned. The ideal candidate would possess the following competencies: Able to learn and interpret specific rules, laws, and policies and apply them with good judgment. Understands proper taxation of employer-paid benefits. Able to perform difficult accounting and statistical work in the maintenance of district records. Able to analyze statistical and financial data. Advance skills using a variety of computer applications, including word processing, database, spreadsheet, accounting software and communication software. Successful experience demonstrating tact, courtesy, a positive attitude, and maintaining cooperative relationships with those contacted during the course of work. EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE Equivalent to an A.A. degree or higher required, with an emphasis in business and/or accounting. Two years of progressively responsible accounting or payroll experience. SALARY & BENEFITS Classified Salary Step 44: $61,396 - $70,521, commensurate with experience. HTH offers a very competitive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision for full-time employees and their dependents. Great pension benefits that include CalPERS Retirement. APPLY TODAY! If you fit the qualifications above and are looking for a forward-thinking, innovative institution that embodies visionary leadership and embraces diversity, then High Tech High is the place for you! Applications must be received on the Filing Deadline Date with the attached: Current Resume Two (2) Letters of Reference/Recommendation High Tech High provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, High Tech High complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the practice has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. This position will close on February 21, 2023.

Principal Business Intelligence Specialist - job post UC San Diego 1,313 reviews San Diego, CA • Hybrid remote $71,000 - $115,500 a year -  Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $71,000 - $115,500 a year Job Type Contract Payroll Title: BUS INTEL SPEC 4 Department: BFS - Business Intelligence & Hiring Pay Scale $71,000 - $115,500 / Year Worksite: Torrey Pines Center South Appointment Type: Contract Appointment Percent: 100% Union: Uncovered Total Openings: 1 Work Schedule: 8 hrs/day, Mon - Fri (Hybrid) #122375 Principal Business Intelligence Specialist Filing Deadline: Thu 4/13/2023 UC San Diego values equity, diversity, and inclusion. If you are interested in being part of our team, possess the needed licensure and certifications, and feel that you have most of the qualifications and/or transferable skills for a job opening, we strongly encourage you to apply. For the safety and well-being of the entire university community, the University of California requires, with few exceptions, that all students, faculty and staff be vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus and influenza before they will be allowed on campus or in a facility or office. For more information visit: Flu Vaccine Mandate / COVID Vaccine Policy This is a 100% contract position through June 30, 2024, with the possibility of extension or conversion to career status, based on business needs and funding availability. DESCRIPTION POSITION OVERVIEW: Incumbent serves as Principal Business Intelligence Specialist in Business Intelligence & Financial Reporting, a division of Business and Financial Services (BFS). For UC San Diego, this position develops highly complex and high visibility Oracle dashboards and reports for BFS division and campus wide usage. Recommends best practices for report development, maintenance, access, and catalog infrastructure. Evaluates data sources for relevance, integrity and accuracy. Identifies issues and collaborates on solutions to data management challenges. Incumbent leads reporting subject matter expert workgroups to identify and understand reporting gaps. Gathers report development requirements from subject matters experts and proposes new report designs to best meet the needs of users. Assists with troubleshooting difficult report development issues and provides recommendations for improving report performance. While this position does not have direct supervisory duties, it does serve as an advisor and mentor to less experienced Oracle developers both on the BI & Financial Reporting team as well as on other BI teams across the university. To review the full job description for this position, please visit: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1w0V4L50yV5OCy5HFf3SpqjVSGvCfLHtz/view?usp=sharing THE "WHY" This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at UC San Diego. Recognized as one of the top 15 research universities worldwide, our culture of collaboration sparks discoveries that advance society and drive economic impact. Best practices and best people at the best place to work! Our candidates come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our organization thrive! Our organizational core values (People First, Innovation, Integrity, Excellence, Accountability) define the culture at Business & Financial Services and push us to be our best. We’re excited to grow our team and learn from people that want to make a difference. If you love what you do and comfortable with designing for the future, we encourage you to consider joining our progressive organization. We recognize that candidates come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of the job. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is the key to innovation and excellence. To do great, we have to be great. Our organization places particular emphasis on equity, diversity, and inclusion incorporating exit interview feedback to enhance retention efforts and advance issues affecting the overall staff experience. If you're a team player with bold ideas and execution, now is the right time to connect! You are encouraged to review additional information about our organization: https://blink.ucsd.edu/finance/about-us/index.html About UCSD: http://ucsd.edu/about/index.html Benefits: http://blink.ucsd.edu/HR/benefits/work-life/health.html This position is also eligible for full: 1) Health/Dental/Vision Insurance 2) Vacation/Holidays 3) Life Insurance 4) UC Retirement Plan QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training. Proven experience in Oracle dashboard intelligence platforms (i.e., OTBI, BI Publisher, FRS), enterprise performance management software, and other analytical technologies. In-depth knowledge of business intelligence functions, advanced analytics, industry standards and best practices. Proven experience in information technologies, including high level of proficiency and understanding with data mapping, data mining and statistical software. Proven statistical and data analysis skills, including high proficiency and understanding with data mapping, data mining, and statistical software tools such as SPSS, SAS, R. Advanced knowledge and skill in internal databases, BI applications, tools, and systems. Extensive demonstrated experience mining data from multiple sources and databases using SQL, Access, pivot tables and other query tools. Advanced project management skills Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. SPECIAL CONDITIONS Background check is required. This is a 100% contract position through June 30, 2024 with the possibility of extension or conversion to career status, based on business needs and funding availability. This position offers a hybrid work arrangement, which includes a combination of onsite and remote work. Pay Transparency Act Annual Full Pay Range: $71,000 - $160,000 (will be prorated if the appointment percentage is less than 100%) Hourly Equivalent: $34.00 - $76.63 Factors in determining the appropriate compensation for a role include experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The Hiring Pay Scale referenced in the job posting is the budgeted salary or hourly range that the University reasonably expects to pay for this position. The Annual Full Pay Range may be broader than what the University anticipates to pay for this position, based on internal equity, budget, and collective bargaining agreements (when applicable). Job offer is contingent on successful engagement in the UC COVID-19 Vaccination program (fully vaccinated with documented proof or approved exception/deferral). To foster the best possible working and learning environment, UC San Diego strives to cultivate a rich and diverse environment, inclusive and supportive of all students, faculty, staff and visitors. For more information, please visit UC San Diego Principles of Community. The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, gender identity or sexual orientation. For the complete University of California nondiscrimination and affirmative action policy see: http://www-hr.ucsd.edu/saa/nondiscr.html UC San Diego is a smoke and tobacco free environment. Please visit smokefree.ucsd.edu for more information.
